summary:
The World Youth Choir, a project of the ''Foundation World Youth Choir'' is a genuine educational and social experience drawing on many vocal traditions, aiming for the highest artistic level. By music education, professional artistic approach, multicultural social interaction and exchange the World Youth Choir unites 40 to 80 young choral singers age 18 to 30 from all over the world at projects organized in different countries each or every other year. Artistically, singers develop their musical talents by interacting with internationally renowned conductors performing choral music of various styles, time periods and the many genres of each continent at a professional level. The choir performs both a cappella and with distinguished youth or national orchestras, further expanding its message of artistic unity. Socially, and regardless of political or cultural differences, singers share up to a month of their lives together. They work, play, converse, and debate. Such communal living creates a genuine spirit of understanding, lifelong friendships, and a cohesive group with a unique bond. This is why UNESCO has awarded the World Youth Choir with the “Artist for Peace” title in 1996, recognizing its success as a platform for intercultural dialogue through music.

WE ARE...  
- EXPANDING HORIZONS for young, talented musicians (capacity building, new approaches, innovation). 
- SUPPORTING personal endeavors of each participant (career development and networking). 
- BUILDING NEW social and communal CAPABILITIES chorally. 
- PROMOTING organizational capacities as well as social, cultural and historical achievements of the host country.

AS PROJECT FOR PEACE 
AS MULTICULTURAL,YOUTH MUSICAL SHOWCASE of the highest quality
AS ''INTERNATIONAL CHORAL ACADEMY'' - interactive platform for education and exchange with local individuals and groups

treasury_media.title: World Youth Choir on stage in short!
World Youth Choir in Oslo, Nobel Peace Prize ceremonies 2011

awards.title: Milestones
awards.description:
Milestones
1990 | 2nd World Symposium of Choral Music in Stockholm |
1992 | Olympic Gala performances in Barcelona |
1996 | Awarded “Artist for peace” by UNESCO |
2002 | 6th World Choral Symposium in Minneapolis |
2002 | Awarded the prestigious Robert Edler Prize |
2004 | 60th anniversary of the Normandy landings in World War 2 |
2006 | XVI Europa Cantat Festival, Mainz, Germany |
2008 | Olympic Equestrian Games, Hong Kong P.R.O. China |
2009 | XVII Europa Cantat Festival, Utrecht, the Netherlands |
2011 | Nobel Peace Prize Award Ceremony, Oslo, Norway | Nobel Peace Prize concert, Oslo, Norway |

awards.title: What have we done since 1989?
awards.description:
What have we done since 1989?  
35+ sessions | 1000 singers in total | 65+ countries represented
46 world - class conductors | from 20+ countries on 5 continents
100+ recruiters | 75+ countries on 5 continents 
250+ audition applications per year | 45+ countries
20+ CD's and documentary DVD's published | 20+ hours of world's best choral music selection recorded

...while touring 30+ countries on 4 continents: Sweden, Belgium, Hungary, Spain, Norway, Uruguay and Argentina, Canada, Estonia, Latvia, Finland, Japan, Taiwan, Slovenia, South Africa, Venezuela,  Italy, United States of America, Switzerland, Austria, France, South Korea, Israel; Germany, Namibia, Netherlands, P.R.O. China - Hong Kong, Macao and mainland China (Guangzhou), Canary Islands, Balearic Islands and Iberian Peninsula, Oslo, Norway - Nobel Peace Prize Award ceremonies and Cyprus.

projects.title: CURRENT Event packages on offer to future singers and potential session hosts
projects.description:
July/August session of 3 weeks maximum, 40 to 80 singers age 18-30, extensive international selection.
December/January session of 2 weeks maximum, 40 to 60 internationally selected singers, age 18-30/32.
Special projects throughout the year - cooperation with internationally recognized institutions of a high profile and/or projects within the global events of the highest artistic, cultural, educational, social and political importance. Up to 80 internationally selected singers and alumni age 18-30/35. 

INCLUDING
A preparatory session of medium length (''international choral academy camp'') in the host country 
A concert tour in the host and surrounding countries/region led by internationally renowned conductors
A cappella and/or vocal-instrumental repertoire of various styles, time periods, and genres from all continents

profile_positions.description:
A message of peace to the world 
''Building bridges between young singers from diverse cultures''. As one of the most original and important choral concepts existing nowadays, the World Youth Choir achieves the highest artistic quality while promoting peace and understanding through its inherent diversity. Awarded the ''Artist for Peace'' title by UNESCO in 1996. 

A united world on stage
Since its creation in 1989, the World Youth Choir has established itself as one of the most interesting musical and intercultural experiences offered to young musicians. The professional artistic approach and educational scope offered through multicultural social interaction and exchange are the choir's major achievements. The World Youth Choir unites 40 to 80 young singers age 18 to 30, from all over the world, at projects organized in different countries each or every other year. At present, the choir’s international membership includes over 45 different nationalities representing all continents. 

'Singing the world'
As a multicultural youth ensemble of the highest quality, the World Youth Choir performs choral music of various styles and time periods; its repertoire covers the many genres of each continent. The choir performs both a cappella and with distinguished youth or national orchestras, further expanding its message of artistic unity.

Education, experience and artistry
The World Youth Choir is a genuine educational and social experience drawing on many vocal traditions, aiming for the highest artistic level. Singers develop their musical talents by interacting with internationally renowned conductors and performing challenging repertoires at a professional level. Socially, and regardless of political or cultural differences, singers share a month of their lives together. They work, play, converse, and debate. Such communal living creates a genuine spirit of understanding, lifelong friendships, and a cohesive group with a unique bond.
profile_positions.title: World Youth Choir
